Introduction

One of the advantages of Sparqlycode we would like to offer is an easier to use and more extensible programmatic API for quering code and it's supporting artifacts. PMD is a popular test suite based on the AST and xPath queries. The following tests can be replicated in version 0.0.1a.

OverrideBothEqualsAndHashcode

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/basic.html#OverrideBothEqualsAndHashcode

Answer http://interition.blogspot.co.uk/2014/06/replicating-pmd-overridebothequalsandha.html .


ExtendsObject

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/basic.html#ExtendsObject

Answer....

hmm. this is an interesting one actually. In sparqlycode all Classes explicitly get a java:extends relationship to Object (http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Object) . So we cannot differentiate between those that have it in the code syntax and those that have it resolved implicitly.

eg.

 

# This finds all classes that unnecessarily extend Object

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT * WHERE
 {  
    ?classes java:extends ?e
    
    #<http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Object>  .
    
} LIMIT 100

Open to ideas :-)

ProperCloneImplementation

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/clone.html#ProperCloneImplementation

Another interesting one. The test is checking the clone is done by super.clone() . The xpath is a bit difficult to understand but the key points I think it is making are:

  • there should be no parameters required for the clone method
  • the "ancestor" should be involved

The "ancestor" is referring to the superclass. We can determine the superclass from java:extends but I am not sure what we do with it.

CloneMethodMustImplementCloneable

This was straight forward.

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/clone.html#CloneMethodMustImplementCloneable

# This finds all classes that provide a clone method but do not implement Cloneable

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT ?classes  WHERE
 {  
    ?classes java:method ?method .
    ?method rdfs:label "clone" .
    
    minus {
      ?classes java:implements <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Cloneable> .
    }
    
} LIMIT 100

ExcessiveParameterList

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/codesize.html#ExcessiveParameterList

# This finds methods and their respective classes with an excessive number of parameters. Eg 5

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT ?class ?method (count(?parameter) as ?totalParameters) WHERE
 {  
    ?method java:parameter ?parameter .
    ?class java:method ?method .
}
group by ?class ?method
HAVING (?totalParameters > 5)
limit 100

ExcessivePublicCount

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/codesize.html#ExcessivePublicCount

Two queries. First is to look at public methods. The second, (TODO), looks at public fields.


# This finds classes with an excessive number of public methods . Eg > 10

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT ?class (count(?method) as ?totalPublicMethods) WHERE

 {  
    ?class java:method ?method .
    ?method java:access "Public" .

}
group by ?class
having (?totalPublicMethods > 10)
limit 100

TooManyFields

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/codesize.html#TooManyFields

# This finds classes with an excessive number of public methods . Eg > 10

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT ?class (count(?field) as ?totalPublicFields) WHERE

 {  
    ?class java:field ?field .
    ?field java:access "Public" .

}
group by ?class
having (?totalPublicFields > 10)
limit 100

TooManyMethods

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/codesize.html#TooManyMethods

# This finds classes with an excessive number of methods . Eg > 10

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.example.org/>

SELECT ?class (count(?method) as ?totalMethods) WHERE

 {  
    ?class java:method ?method .
    ?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
    filter (regex(?methodName,"^get|^set|^is","i" ))

}
group by ?class
having (?totalMethods > 10)
limit 100

AtLeastOneConstructor

This one cannot be done at the moment as sparqlycode doesn't distinguish between default and explicitly declared constructors.

DontImportSun

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/controversial.html#DontImportSun

NOTE: This query hasn't been tested due to the lack of support of import statements in sparqlycode.

# Finds classes that import any sun utilities (sun.*).

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class ?imports
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:imports ?imports
FILTER (STRSTARTS(STR(?imports), "http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/sun/"))
}

AvoidPrefixingMethodParameters

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.0.1/rules/java/controversial.html#AvoidPrefixingMethodParameters

# Finds methods with parameters prefixed with 'in' or 'out'.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class ?method ?paramName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method java:parameter ?param .
?param java:name ?paramName .
FILTER (REGEX (?paramName, "^in[A-Z].*") || REGEX (?paramName, "^out[A-Z].*") || REGEX (?paramName, "^in$','^out$"))
}

UseObjectForClearerAPI

ExcessiveImports

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/coupling.html#ExcessiveImports

NOTE: This query hasn't been tested due to the lack of support of import statements in sparqlycode.

# Finds methods with over 30 import statements.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class (count(?imports) as ?totalImports)
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:imports ?imports .
}
GROUP BY ?class
HAVING (?totalImports > 30)
ORDER BY DESC (?totalImports)

UseUtilityClass

FinalFieldCouldBeStatic

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/design.html#FinalFieldCouldBeStatic

# This finds classes with final field declarations that aren't static

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class ?field WHERE

 {
    ?class java:field ?field .
    ?field java:isFinal true .
    FILTER NOT EXISTS {?field java:isStatic true}
}


AvoidProtectedFieldInFinalClass

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.0.5/rules/java/design.html#AvoidProtectedFieldInFinalClass

# This finds protected fields declared in final classes. These fields should not be protected as a final class cannot have subclasses.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class ?field
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:isFinal true .
?class java:field ?field .
?field java:access "Protected" .
}

MissingStaticMethodInNonInstantiatableClass

This one is interesting because the xpath is quite complicated but I think the sparql should be simple

Cannot do at the moment as Constructors do not have enough information in the model..

http://www.interition.net:3030/browse/COD-159

AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/design.html#AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel

# Finds methods that are declared to be synchronized. Synchronization should be used at block-level.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method java:isSynchronized true .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
}

AbstractClassWithoutAbstractMethod

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/snapshot/rules/java/design.html#AbstractClassWithoutAbstractMethod

# This finds abstract classes that have no abstract methods in them.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:isAbstract true .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?class java:method ?method .
?method java:isAbstract true} .
}

AvoidConstantsInterface

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/design.html#AvoidConstantsInterface

# Finds any interface that only has constants in it, and no method declarations.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?interface
WHERE {
?interface a java:Interface .
?interface java:field ?field .
?field java:isStatic true .
?field java:isFinal true .
?field java:access "Public" .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?interface java:method ?method} .
}
GROUP BY ?interface
HAVING ( COUNT (?field) > 0)

ClassWithOnlyPrivateConstructorsShouldBeFinal

No point in doing this without the proper constructor support yet.

AbstractClassWithoutAnyMethod

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/snapshot/rules/java/design.html#AbstractClassWithoutAnyMethod

NOTE: this test excludes investigating constructors. It only checks if the class has any normal methods declared.

# This finds abstract classes that have no methods in them whatsoever.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class (count (?method) as ?totalMethods)
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:isAbstract true .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?class java:method ?method} .
}  group by ?class

UseVarargs

This one is in here because it introduces a new concept we should support and be aware of


FieldDeclarationsShouldBeAtStartOfClass

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.0.0/rules/java/design.html#FieldDeclarationsShouldBeAtStartOfClass

NOTE: This query does not take constructors into account yet.

# This finds fields declared somewhere other than the top of the class.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?class ?fieldName ?fieldLN
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:field ?field .
?field java:lineNumber ?fieldLN .
?field rdfs:label ?fieldName .
?class java:method ?method .
?method java:lineNumber ?methodLN .
OPTIONAL {
           ?class java:innerClassOf ?parentClass .
           ?class java:lineNumber ?innerClassLN .
         }
FILTER (?fieldLN > ?methodLN || ?fieldLN > ?innerClassLN)
}

AvoidProtectedMethodInFinalClassNotExtending

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/design.html#AvoidProtectedMethodInFinalClassNotExtending

# Finds protected methods in final classes that don't extend other classes with protected methods.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:extends <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Object> .
?class java:isFinal true .
?class java:method ?method .
?method java:access "Protected" .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
}

FinalizeOverloaded

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/finalizers.html#FinalizeOverloaded

# This finds any overloaded instances of the void finalize() method. It should not have any parameters.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX sc: <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class (COUNT (?parameter) as ?totalParameters)
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label "finalize" .
?method java:returns sc:void .
?method java:parameter ?parameter .
}
GROUP BY ?class
HAVING (?totalParameters > 0)

FinalizeShouldBeProtected

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/snapshot/rules/java/finalizers.html#FinalizeShouldBeProtected

# Checks if there is a public overriding instance of the finalize() method. These should be protected.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX sc: <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label "finalize" .
?method java:returns sc:void .
?method java:access "Public" .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?method java:parameter ?parameter} .
}

StaticEJBFieldShouldBeFinal

DoNotUseThreads

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/j2ee.html#DoNotUseThreads

# Finds classes that extend Thread or implement Runnable.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
               {?class java:implements <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Runnable> .}
               UNION 
               {?class java:extends <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Thread> . }
}

BeanMembersShouldSerialize

MissingSerialVersionUID

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/javabeans.html#MissingSerialVersionUID

# Checks if a class that is implementing java.io.Serializable has the field SerialVersionUID declared.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:implements <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/io/Serializable> .
?class java:field ?field .
        FILTER NOT EXISTS {
                ?field java:isPrivate true.
                ?field java:isStatic true .
                ?field java:isFinal true .
                ?field rdfs:label "serialVersionUID"
        }
}

JUnitStaticSuite

JUnitSpelling

JUnit4TestShouldUseBeforeAnnotation

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/migrating.html#JUnit4TestShouldUseBeforeAnnotation

# Finds any class that uses a setUp method without the @Before annotation.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label "setUp" .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?method java:hasAnnotation <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/org/junit/Before>} .
}

JUnit4TestShouldUseAfterAnnotation

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/migrating.html#JUnit4TestShouldUseAfterAnnotation

# Finds any class that uses a tearDown method without the @After annotation.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label "tearDown" .
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?method java:hasAnnotation <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/org/junit/After>} .


JUnit4TestShouldUseTestAnnotation

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/migrating.html#JUnit4TestShouldUseTestAnnotation

# Finds any class that uses a method starting with the wort 'test' but not using the @Test annotation.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName
FILTER (STRSTARTS(STR(?methodName), "test"))
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?method java:hasAnnotation <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/org/junit/Test> .}
}

LoggerIsNotStaticFinal

ShortMethodName

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/naming.html#ShortMethodName

# Finds methods with less than 3-character names.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
FILTER (REGEX (?methodName,  "^.{0,2}$"))
}

MethodNamingConventions

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.2.6/rules/naming.html#MethodNamingConventions

# Finds methods starting with an upper case letter or containing underscores.
PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
FILTER (REGEX (?methodName,  "^[A-Z]") || REGEX (?methodName, ".[_]"))
}

ClassNamingConventions

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.2.6/rules/naming.html#ClassNamingConventions

# Finds classes with a name starting with a lower case letter.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?className
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class rdfs:label ?className
FILTER (REGEX (?className,  "^[a-z]"))
}

AbstractNaming

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.2.6/rules/naming.html#AbstractNaming

# Finds abstract classes whose name does not start with 'Abstract'.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:isAbstract true .
?class rdfs:label ?className .
FILTER  (REGEX (?className,  "^(?!Abstract).+"))
}

AvoidDollarSigns

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.2.5/rules/naming.html#AvoidDollarSigns

# Find classes or interfaces with class / method / field including the '$' sign.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?fieldName ?methodName
WHERE {
{
?class a java:Class .
?class rdfs:label ?className .
OPTIONAL {
    ?class java:field ?field .
    ?class rdfs:label ?fieldName .
    ?class java:method ?method .
    ?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
    }
FILTER (REGEX(?className, ".[$]") || REGEX(?fieldName, ".[$]") || REGEX(?methodName, ".[$]"))
}
UNION {
?class a java:Interface .
?class rdfs:label ?interfaceName .
OPTIONAL {
    ?class java:field ?field .
    ?field rdfs:label ?fieldName .
    ?class java:method ?method .
    ?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
    }
FILTER (REGEX(?interfaceName, ".[$]") || REGEX(?fieldName, ".[$]") || REGEX(?methodName, ".[$]"))
}
}

ShortClassName

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.1.1/rules/java/naming.html#ShortClassName

# Finds classes with less than 5 chararcters in their name.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class rdfs:label ?className .
FILTER  (REGEX (?className,  "^.{0,4}$"))
}

GenericsNaming

Nice juicy one ! we have to have got a good command of our model applied to Generics to do this.


SignatureDeclareThrowsException

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/strictexception.html#SignatureDeclareThrowsException

# Finds any method that throws java.lang.Exception.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:method ?method .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
?method java:throws <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Exception> .
}

DoNotExtendJavaLangError

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-4.3/rules/strictexception.html#DoNotExtendJavaLangError

# Finds classes that extend Java.lang.Error

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>

SELECT ?class
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:extends <http://www.interition.net/sparqlycode/id/java/lang/Error>
}

UnnecessaryFinalModifier

http://pmd.sourceforge.net/pmd-5.0.5/rules/java/unnecessary.html#UnnecessaryFinalModifier

# Finds methods explicitly declared final inside final classes.

PREFIX java: <http://www.interition.net/java/ref/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?class ?methodName
WHERE {
?class a java:Class .
?class java:isFinal true .
?class java:method ?method .
?method java:isFinal true .
?method rdfs:label ?methodName .
}
